text: Pours hazy orange with a big off white head. Aroma of citrus, some nice floral hops and a good soft Brett aspect. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Nothing like an Oktoberfest beer but better

Bottle:
White head. Cloudy yellow.
Hoppy aroma.
Easy drinking watery hoppy beer.
Nice bitter, good (funky) fruit tones.
Aftertaste is also bitter fruity, very nice.
Low carbo, creamy light dry mouthfeel, medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from Burg Bieren, batch 14080 BB 16-12-2015, large sample. Slight hazy yellow color, big rocky off-white head. Aroma of flowery hops, some citrus, slight spicy yeast, bit funky brett as well. Slight grainy malt. Bit sweet in taste, fruity, soft bitterness. Dont know whats oktoberfest about it, but its a very tasty blonde.

Aroma of slightly tart fruits, citrus, floral notes, grassy hops. Flavour is light sweet and light tart with a light bitter finish. Very refreshing. Not your typical Märzen, which I guess is a good thing.

Clear golden colour, white head. Malty, hoppy aroma, apricot, tropical fruits. Malty flavour, light bitter, straw, fruity hops. Quite full body. Light sweet, light bitter finish, straw. Not your typical Märzen, but to be honest Id prefer this take on the style above a more traditional example any time.

Tap @ In De Wildeman. Golden color, slightly hazy. White head, slowly diminishing. Aromas: fruit (sour almost), some grain. Fruit, hopbitter, light funk and grain retronasal. Flavor is light malty sweet, light bitter, some fruity sourness. Light bodied, but not thin. Finishes with grain and a moderate bitterness. More a saison than an Oktoberfest, but a very nice brew anyway.
Bottle. Golden color. Lime in the slightly herbal aroma. Malty lime flavor. Soft grassy herbal notes.. passion fruit. Not as malty as a märzen should be, but a lovely brew.

Draft at In De Wildeman, 20/11/2014. Pours hazy orange with a big off white head. Aroma of citrus, some nice floral hops and a good soft Brett aspect. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Nothing like an Oktoberfest beer but better!
Poured slightly hazy orange amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of moderately sweet citrus, soft malt. Medium body, flavour is medium to heavy sweet, lightly bitter.

75 cL bottle at home. Pours hazy golden/orange with a medium off-white head. Aroma has some fruitiness, hops, oranges, floral notes and some maltiness. Taste has some fruitiness, oranges, hops and a nicely bitter finish. Medium body and carbo. Not really true to the style I guess, but pretty tasty.

sample from draft at van moll. poured a hazy amber-ish colour with a off head, im not a fan of the style. but it was suprisingly good. lots of floral hops, crisp malt, nice fruity, pretty good beer. that doesnt have this oktoberfest style!

Draught @ Van Moll Brewpub 1 year anniversary party. Hazy orangy color, medium sized off-white head. Nice fruity lightly hoppy aroma. Didnt expect this from an Oktoberfest beer. Taste is fruity and hoppy with a slight hint of fruitpeel. Decent body and carbonation.
